skill.name: arxiv-search
skill.description: Search arXiv preprint repository for papers in physics, mathematics, computer science, quantitative biology, and related fields.
skill.summary: Search arXiv preprint repository for papers in physics, mathematics, computer science, quantitative ...
skill.author: DougTrajano

security_audit.summary: This is a read-only research tool that queries the public arXiv API. The code makes no file system modifications, executes no external commands, accesses no environment variables, and sends no data to unauthorized endpoints. Static findings are false positives from the scanner misinterpreting markdown code blocks as shell backticks and argparse descriptions as cryptographic algorithms.

content.value_statement: Finding relevant research papers across physics, mathematics, computer science, and quantitative biology is time-consuming. This skill provides direct access to the arXiv preprint repository to search and retrieve papers with their titles, abstracts, and links.
actual_capabilities: Search arXiv by keyword or topic
Retrieve paper titles, abstracts, and URLs
limitations: Does not provide full-text access to papers
Results are limited to arXiv preprints only
No advanced search filters beyond relevance sorting

use_cases.title: Find preprints before journal publication
use_cases.description: Locate recent papers in your research area before peer review for staying current with cutting-edge work.

use_cases.title: Build literature review foundations
use_cases.description: Discover foundational and recent papers on a topic for thesis research and coursework assignments.

use_cases.title: Search ML papers by topic
use_cases.description: Find machine learning and AI papers with specific applications like protein folding or single-cell analysis.

prompt_templates.title: Limited results
prompt_templates.prompt: Search arxiv for {topic} papers, limit to {n} results

prompt_templates.title: Specific domain
prompt_templates.prompt: Find recent preprints on {topic} in {field} such as q-bio or cs.LG

prompt_templates.title: Methodology search
prompt_templates.prompt: Search arxiv for papers about {method} applied to {problem}

output_examples.input: Search arxiv for neural networks protein folding
output: Summary: A neural network architecture for protein structure prediction
Title: Deep Learning for Protein Folding
Summary: Deep learning approach for protein folding prediction

output_examples.input: Search arxiv for large language models mathematical reasoning
output: Title: Chain of Thought Reasoning in LLMs
Summary: Methods for improving mathematical reasoning
Title: Formal Mathematics with Language Models
Summary: Using LLMs for theorem proving

output_examples.input: Search arxiv for single cell RNA-seq analysis
output: Summary: Comparison of clustering algorithms for single-cell data
Summary: Neural networks for single-cell gene expression analysis

best_practices: Use specific keywords to narrow results to your exact research area
Start with default 10 results and increase if needed for broader searches
Combine related terms like machine learning AND drug discovery for focused results
anti_patterns: Asking for full-text content - the skill only retrieves metadata
Expecting peer-reviewed papers - arXiv contains preprints
Searching without keywords - provide specific terms for best results

faq.question: Is an arXiv account required to use this skill?
faq.answer: No. This skill accesses the public arXiv API without authentication. No account needed.

faq.question: What topics can I search on arXiv?
faq.answer: Physics, mathematics, computer science, quantitative biology, finance, statistics, and engineering.

faq.question: Can I access full papers through this skill?
faq.answer: No. The skill retrieves titles, abstracts, and URLs. You must visit arXiv for full papers.

faq.question: How many results can I retrieve?
faq.answer: Default is 10 papers. Use --max-papers to increase up to any reasonable limit for your needs.

faq.question: Are arXiv papers peer-reviewed?
faq.answer: arXiv contains preprints. Many papers are later published in journals with peer review.

faq.question: How is this different from Google Scholar?
faq.answer: arXiv covers specific STEM fields with free access. Google Scholar is broader but includes paywalled content.
